The event mentioned in the sentence is "I will pull the trigger."
Post:
"I will pull the trigger because I am a nervous and impulsive person."

It is important to note that attributions made using the stable attributional style tend to be more negative and pessimistic. This is because the cause of the event is seen as chronic and long-lasting, which can lead to feelings of hopelessness and helplessness. In contrast, attributions made using other attributional styles, such as the entity attributional style or the incremental attributional style, tend to be more positive and optimistic.

It is also important to note that people's attributional styles can vary across different domains of life, and can also change over time. For example, someone may use a stable attributional style when explaining their own failures, but use an incremental attributional style when explaining the successes of others. Additionally, people's attributional styles can be influenced by various factors such as their upbringing, cultural background, and life experiences.

Event: The writer is experiencing a prolonged period of mental and emotional suffering due to their battle with bipolar disorder. This event is characterized by feelings of inner death, hopelessness, and a sense of being stuck in a never-ending cycle of negativity and pain. The writer has tried various forms of therapy and self-discipline but has not been able to find lasting relief from their suffering. They feel lost and alone, with no hope for a better future.

I've tried everything from therapy to self-discipline, but nothing seems to offer lasting relief. I feel lost and alone, trapped in a never-ending cycle of suffering. It's like there's a black cloud following me everywhere, casting a shadow over even the smallest glimmers of hope. I'm starting to lose faith that things will ever get better."

Event:
The writer is experiencing intrusive suicidal thoughts and feelings of hopelessness, anxiety, and confusion after being triggered by the news of Chester Bennington's suicide.

The main event in this passage is the writer's experience of intrusive suicidal thoughts and feelings of hopelessness, which are described as "horrific" and "real." The writer also mentions feeling like they are losing control and experiencing physical urges that are difficult to describe. These symptoms are consistent with suicide ideation and may indicate a higher risk of suicide.

It is important to note that the writer is unsure if these feelings are intrusive or true suicide ideation, which can make it difficult to determine the appropriate course of action. However, given the severity of the symptoms described, it is recommended that the writer seek professional help from a mental health provider as soon as possible. A mental health professional can evaluate the writer's symptoms and provide a proper diagnosis and treatment plan.
Post: "I'm feeling overwhelmed with suicidal thoughts and feelings of hopelessness after hearing about Chester Bennington's suicide. I'm unsure if these thoughts are intrusive or true suicide ideation, but they feel so real and scary. I'm experiencing physical urges that are hard to describe and feeling like I'm losing control. I know I need help, so I'm reaching out to a mental health professional for support. #suicideprevention #mentalhealthmatters"

Event:
My boyfriend's friend asked my friend if he could take a shot from her belly button, and she said no. He then asked me and I felt bad for him, so I laid on the pool table and one of my friends poured the shot in my belly button and put a lemon in my mouth.

Fluent and general expression: My boyfriend's friend requested a shot from my friend's belly button, which she declined. He then turned to me and I felt bad for him, so I participated in the activity to make him feel better. However, my boyfriend is upset about the situation and I am trying to figure out how to resolve the issue and make things right between us.
Post: "I'm always a sucker for a sad puppy face, so when my boyfriend's friend asked my friend for a shot from her belly button and she said no, I couldn't help but feel bad for him. I knew he was just trying to have a good time, so I laid on the pool table and let one of my friends pour the shot in my belly button and put a lemon in my mouth. My boyfriend is upset about it now, but I hope he can understand that I was just trying to make his friend feel better. #SAS #StableAttributionalStyle"
